=C2=A0Okay, that was harsh! Put=
 my claws back in. Been doing this stuff=C2=A0for ten years and there's alw=
ays someone that thinks they are somehow more qualified and more intelligen=
t than anyone else. I've been doing EVP related work for ten years, that do=
es not mean I have had no other experience, have not read a butt load of bo=
oks, and have no intuition-. I've been having "paranormal expereince" befor=
e most of=C2=A0the people on this group were born, and it really pisses me =
off to be talked down to.=C2=A0 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0I say the images are real, an=
d are not at all rare, and once again I state--we are the ones with all the=
 limitations! If someone on the other side has been working on technology f=
or 1000 years, how simple do you think it is for them to embed images in ev=
ery and any=C2=A0freaking thing they want to? Forget the Hollywood nonsense=
 of spirit being a deminished human zombie incapable of any action on this =
side.
=C2=A0
F-S
=C2=A0

ank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

ompus A-holes coming down on everyone else. That is exactly what you came a=

On =
Sun, Dec 19, 2010 at 3:49 PM, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:
=


=C2=A0 



Frank, 


WTF?


Did I second guess anyone? =C2=A0No.


Did I =
prejudge all evidence? =C2=A0No.


Was I aware of this? =C2=A0Yes. =C2=A0Di=
d I mention it before? =C2=A0No. =C2=A0Why? =C2=A0Because it did not intere=
st me until now because I did not know the software was available for downl=
oading.


You are putting a helluva lot of assumptions out there about me F=
rank, and you know me better than to ever equate me with the TAPS bullshit.=
 =C2=A0At least I thought you did.


All I can ask is WTF? =C2=A0Can no one=
 understand basic English in a freaking post anymore? =C2=A0


I attacked n=
o one. =C2=A0I attacked no evidence. =C2=A0I did not give specific opinion =
about the validity of evidence until forced to by Ursula's last post. =C2=
=A0I only said what I would need to quantify before I start posting images.=
 =C2=A0And you have really jumped the shark here, Frank, and I have no idea=
 why.


Tim






On Sun, Dec 19, 2010 at 5:10 PM, Frank Sumption <purpleal=
iengirl@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 




HUH? You've been aware of this for =
so long? That's another thing that gets me, people think they are such frig=
gin' great experts that they prejudge all evidence and and second guess eve=
ryone. 

=C2=A0So this wasn't important enough to mention, cuz you already =
judged it to be bogus? Everyone thinks they are to world's onlyest freaking=

=C2=A0
=C2=A0I with Hultay, shut down the groups a=
nd tell everyone bite me! Go join TAPS if you want all this to corespond to=

=C2=A0
On Sun, =
Dec 19, 2010 at 7:31 AM, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


=C2=
=A0 



Relax Ursula. 


I too have been aware of this at Keith's site for =
long, long time, but like I said in the last post, I am very new to this as=
 in doing it on my own computer. =C2=A0Just like you. =C2=A0So don't act li=
ke you know what I do and do not know, thank you very much. =C2=A0


I am n=
ot attacking you so back the hell off. =C2=A0I made it clear that this was =
for my own own edification, for me to accept my own images.=C2=A0=C2=A0


T=
he image I ever so briefly mentioned the one posted that had several "Faces=
" or pieces thereof that were circled. =C2=A0As for your image of the man p=
eeking out, I saw nothing there. =C2=A0Period. =C2=A0=C2=A0Did I say previo=
usly what I thought about the quality of the images in that photo? =C2=A0No=
. =C2=A0I politely kept it to myself because I do not like to differ with p=
eople or to deflate hot air balloons. =C2=A0But there you have it, that is =
what I saw. =C2=A0And to my knowledge, that is the only time I have describ=
ed what I have seen thus far in your images other than mentioning the word =
"eyebrows." =C2=A0In the one that had many circles, I saw one that looked l=
ike a set of lips and a chin and the rest I personally thought was matrixin=
g. =C2=A0Once again, did I saw this? =C2=A0No. =C2=A0But you asked for it s=
o there it is.


The whole point of my post, had you read it with a clear h=
ead. =C2=A0It was all about my own edification, that I, and I alone, need t=
o keep plugging in files before I, and I alone, make a judgement about MY i=
mages and whether they are real or not based upon the images they provide i=
n contrast to the bulk of other files. =C2=A0If you simply compare your one=
 image with the many circles to the youtube file, I suspect I am correct in=
 saying that faces occur with much more rarity than your circle file and th=
at they can appear fully formed. =C2=A0Once again, I suspect, only, and I w=
ill only be able to tell after time. =C2=A0Sample size is everything, and I=
 thought I made that abundantly clear. =C2=A0The post was simply about my p=
rocess of learning rather than running out and saying look what I found whe=
n I simply don't know what has been found yet because it is the first time =
I have played with the controls rather than seeing the end snapshots on ano=
ther persons website. =C2=A0


Why do you always jump on the defensive and =
attack every one who does not fall in line with you? =C2=A0Not everything h=
as to be fight or flight, Ursula, and not every bridge has to be burned so =
thoroughly to the ground. =C2=A0This is not an attack on you or results, re=
read the post, and this time thinking a little more clearly about what is w=
ritten on the page and not your own emotional backlash construing things in=
 the posted text that are simply not there. =C2=A0Had you done this, you wo=
uld have seen the point of my post was not an attack on you, in ANY way. =
=C2=A0 =C2=A0


Tim

--- On Sat, 12/18/10, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


Fr=
om: Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: ok so =
im getting stuff on the spectergram
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Satur=
day, December 18, 2010, 4:57 PM


=C2=A0 

No, I don't think I am being too=
 critical, but I may have expectations that are a little too high. =C2=A0I =
want to take my time with this. =C2=A0For my own understanding, I need to h=
ave a large sample size so I know not only what to expect to see, but what =
to look for. =C2=A0I have seen ITC snapshots from programs like this that o=
ffer full faces. =C2=A0I would be more inclined to believe in such an image=
 as opposed to, lets say. two dark lines that may or may not be eyebrows. 
=


Even in your example of the towel, you get half a face. =C2=A0If you have=
 half a face (on the vertical plane, not the horizontal) you can extrapolat=
e out what the entire face would look like. =C2=A0This is something I would=
 like to get myself and I would consider that evidence if it showed up in o=
ne of these programs. =C2=A0But, if you have something that looks like a fo=
rehead and that is all there is, then it could also look like a rock or som=
e other such object.


I am certainly hoping for results worked into box se=
ssions. =C2=A0Directing a session with intent, like saying "I am going to e=
xamine the sound waves of this communication in hopes of seeing your face. =
=C2=A0Is it possible you can show your face to me now through sound? " is w=
hat I am after. =C2=A0If a positive hit like this happens, then I will be j=
umping for joy. =C2=A0Another good example would be a name, lets say Tom, t=
hat occurs. =C2=A0If you get a positive affirmation that the name you heard=
 is present, then you try the same technique only you address Tom by name a=
nd get a face, that would be even better.


But, as it stands now, the face=
s as they appear are random at best. =C2=A0I would be more inclined to beli=
eve that when these faces do occur , they are going to occur with a lesser =
frequency than multiple images in a few seconds of audio like Ursula's exam=
ple. =C2=A0If this where the case, there would be dozens, and possibly hund=
reds, of faces during a ten minute session and I just don't think that is p=
ossible. =C2=A0This is why I need to look at several samples to find out if=
 this is the case or not. =C2=A0If these partialized faces occur in multipl=
es all the time, I would be more apt to discount it. =C2=A0But, if they are=
 a rarity affixed to only a few clips out of dozens, I would be more inclin=
ed to believe in them. =C2=A0Sample size is everything. =C2=A0It is like li=
stening to GBC. =C2=A0If you have never done a session before, you would be=
 inclined to believe every stray radio signal is a communication. =C2=A0Onl=
y by continued practice (expanding your sample size) can you start to
 rule=
 out stray radio with any degree of accuracy. =C2=A0


On the other hand, I=
 am very new to this and I could certainly be wrong. =C2=A0I will continue =
to plug sound into the programs and hope for the best. =C2=A0


I really wa=
nt this to work. =C2=A0As you have probably experienced, when they want you=
 to hear something or know something, they make it very obvious while commu=
nicating. =C2=A0I am hoping they apply this same rigor to this new format t=
o show us that they are there. =C2=A0If they can, then the world of video a=
nd audio ITC will merge in one source and then the skeptics be damned!


Ti=
m


On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 2:24 PM, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@gmail.=
com> wrote:


=C2=A0 




=C2=A0I think it's unrealistic to expect every fi=
le to have faces and images. These faces are often just portions, eyes and =
lips, some have eye brows. Like all of this, not done for proof, it's for e=
motional impact.=C2=A0 I have this woman that shows up in towels, always ju=
st half the face. Perahps you are being too critical? As with all spirit me=
ssages, it's what it means to the experiencer that matters. Expecting full =
faces is like expecting the kings english and proper grammer in all EVPs. 
=
=C2=A0
F-S





On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 3:07 AM, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth=
@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 



I saw a couple which could be construed as =
images in the one series you had from SEA, but nothing that knocked me over=
 the head yet. =C2=A0I am going to have to see a larger sample size before =
I determine if what you have witnessed is in fact a form or not. =C2=A0I ca=
nnot accept an image as paranormal without knowing where it sits among the =
bulk of audio files. =C2=A0If every file has multiple faces, the I would ha=
ve =C2=A0to say that there is nothing there. 


So, I will certainly keep t=
esting with my copy and hopefully something will really pop for me. =C2=A0I=
 have run through about ten files (EVP and GBC) so far for intensive study =
and I still haven't got anything that I would consider a positive hit. =C2=
=A0I need an actual formed face, not portions thereof, to consider an image=
 real. =C2=A0This is the only way to discount visual matrixing.


I have hi=
gh hopes for this though!


Tim

On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 1:00 AM, psi_research <vilhellm@...> wr=
ote:


=C2=A0 



I've seen live webcast of ITC sessions where GB output is=
 fed directly into the mic line in on a computer running Adobe Audition wit=
h the spectragraph running. It was really compelling to see letters and num=
bers, not images or pictures, but partial words appear in the graph. At fir=
st it was I thought it was a software glitch but it is a repeatable event. =
It was on LiveSciFi which is run by Tim Wood, he also thought there was som=
e kind of code error but it happened on more than one webcast. 

So if anyo=
ne has Audition, just feed Box output right in your computer and see what h=
appens. I wanted to try it tonight but I have Audacity and the spectragraph=
 feature doesn't have that shaded appearance that Audition does so it's not=
 able to render images or characters, at least as far as I see using the va=
rious settings.

h@...> wrote:

DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I too have been aware of this at Keith's site for long,=

oing it on my own computer.  Just like you.  So don't act like yo=
u know what I do and do not know, thank you very much.  </DIV>
<DIV><B=
R></DIV>
<DIV>I am not attacking you so back the hell off.  I made it =
clear that this was for my own own edification, for me to accept my own ima=
ges.  </DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>The image I ever so briefly men=
tioned the one posted that had several "Faces" or pieces thereof that were =
circled.  As for your image of the man peeking out, I saw nothing ther=
e.  Period.   Did I say previously what I thought about the =
quality of the images in that photo?  No.  I politely kept it to =
myself because I do not like to differ with people or to deflate hot air ba=
lloons.  But there you have it, that is what I saw.  And to my kn=
owledge, that is the only time I have described what I have seen thus far i=
n your images other than mentioning the word "eyebrows."  In the one t=
hat had many circles, I saw one that looked like a set of lips and a chin a=
nd the rest I personally thought was matrixing.  Once again, did I saw=
 this?  No.  But you asked for it so there it is.</DIV>
<DIV><BR>=
</DIV>
<DIV>The whole point of my post, had you read it with a clear head. =
 It was all about my own edification, that I, and I alone, need to kee=
p plugging in files before I, and I alone, make a judgement about MY images=
 and whether they are real or not based upon the images they provide in con=
trast to the bulk of other files.  If you simply compare your one imag=
e with the many circles to the youtube file, I suspect I am correct in sayi=
ng that faces occur with much more rarity than your circle file and that th=
ey can appear fully formed.  Once again, I suspect, only, and I will o=
nly be able to tell after time.  Sample size is everything, and I thou=
ght I made that abundantly clear.  The post was simply about my proces=
s of learning rather than running out and saying look what I found when I s=
imply don't know what has been found yet because it is the first time I hav=
e played with the controls rather than seeing the end snapshots on another
=
 persons website.  </DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Why do you always jump =
on the defensive and attack every one who does not fall in line with you? &=
nbsp;Not everything has to be fight or flight, Ursula, and not every bridge=
 has to be burned so thoroughly to the ground.  This is not an attack =
on you or results, reread the post, and this time thinking a little more cl=
early about what is written on the page and not your own emotional backlash=
 construing things in the posted text that are simply not there.  Had =
you done this, you would have seen the point of my post was not an attack o=
n you, in ANY way.    </DIV>

<DIV>
<DIV>No, I don't think I am being too =
critical, but I may have expectations that are a little too high.  I w=
ant to take my time with this.  For my own understanding, I need to ha=
ve a large sample size so I know not only what to expect to see, but what t=
o look for.  I have seen ITC snapshots from programs like this that of=
fer full faces.  I would be more inclined to believe in such an image =
as opposed to, lets say. two dark lines that may or may not be eyebrows. 
<=
DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Even in your example of the towel, you get half a face.=
  If you have half a face (on the vertical plane, not the horizontal) =
you can extrapolate out what the entire face would look like.  This is=
 something I would like to get myself and I would consider that evidence if=
 it showed up in one of these programs.  But, if you have something th=
at looks like a forehead and that is all there is, then it could also look =
like a rock or some other such object.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I am cert=
ainly hoping for results worked into box sessions.  Directing a sessio=
n with intent, like saying "I am going to examine the sound waves of this c=
ommunication in hopes of seeing your face.  Is it possible you can sho=
w your face to me now through sound? " is what I am after.  If a posit=
ive hit like this happens, then I will be jumping for joy.  Another go=
od example would be a name, lets say Tom, that occurs.  If you get a p=
ositive affirmation that the name you heard is present, then you try the sa=
me technique only you address Tom by name and get a face, that would be eve=
n better.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>But, as it stands now, the faces as th=
ey appear are random at best.  I would be more inclined to believe tha=
t when these faces do occur , they are going to occur with a lesser frequen=
cy than multiple images in a few seconds of audio like Ursula's example. &n=
bsp;If this where the case, there would be dozens, and possibly hundreds, o=
f faces during a ten minute session and I just don't think that is possible=
.  This is why I need to look at several samples to find out if this i=
s the case or not.  If these partialized faces occur in multiples all =
the time, I would be more apt to discount it.  But, if they are a rari=
ty affixed to only a few clips out of dozens, I would be more inclined to b=
elieve in them.  Sample size is everything.  It is like listening=
 to GBC.  If you have never done a session before, you would be inclin=
ed to believe every stray radio signal is a communication.  Only by co=
ntinued practice
 (expanding your sample size) can you start to rule out st=
ray radio with any degree of accuracy.  </DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>On=
 the other hand, I am very new to this and I could certainly be wrong. &nbs=
p;I will continue to plug sound into the programs and hope for the best. &n=
bsp;</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I really want this to work.  As you ha=
ve probably experienced, when they want you to hear something or know somet=
hing, they make it very obvious while communicating.  I am hoping they=
 apply this same rigor to this new format to show us that they are there. &=
nbsp;If they can, then the world of video and audio ITC will merge in one s=
ource and then the skeptics be damned!</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Tim<BR><B=

<DIV=
><BR></DIV>
<DIV>So, I will certainly keep testing with my copy and hopeful=

y to discount visual matrixing.</DIV>
